intro: Dombeya subviscosa subsp. sakarahae, commonly known as the Sakaraha dombeya, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Its flowers are usually pink or white and bloom during the rainy season. The subspecies is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
